name: World War II
description: During World War II, various drugs were used by different military forces to enhance soldier performance and endurance.
impact: The widespread use of stimulants, particularly methamphetamine by German forces and amphetamines by Allied forces, significantly influenced military operations and post-war drug policies.

name: Vietnam War
description: The Vietnam War saw extensive drug use among American soldiers, both for combat enhancement and recreational purposes.
impact: Drug use during the Vietnam War led to significant addiction issues among veterans and influenced American drug policy and rehabilitation programs.

name: Cold War Era
description: During the Cold War, various military and intelligence agencies experimented with drugs for mind control and enhanced interrogation.
impact: Cold War drug experiments led to increased understanding of psychoactive substances but also raised serious ethical concerns about human experimentation.

name: American Civil War
description: Morphine was widely used during the American Civil War to treat injured soldiers, often leading to long-term dependency.
impact: The war saw the rise of what was called the 'Soldier’s Disease', a term used to describe morphine addiction in returning veterans.

name: Napoleonic Wars
description: Alcohol and opium were commonly used to treat wounds and manage battlefield stress during the Napoleonic Wars.
impact: The use of opium in field medicine spread throughout Europe, influencing civilian medical practices.

name: Soviet-Afghan War
description: Drugs were used both by soldiers and warlords. The conflict helped solidify Afghanistan's place in global opium production.
impact: This war contributed to the rise of Afghanistan’s narcotics trade, which continues to impact global drug markets today.

name: Opium Wars
description: Fought primarily over British trade of opium in China, these wars had massive implications for international drug control.
impact: The wars led to widespread opium addiction in China and reshaped trade relationships and colonial power dynamics.

name: Gulf War
description: Stimulants and antidepressants were reportedly used by soldiers to stay alert during extended operations in the Gulf War.
impact: The psychological toll and substance use during the Gulf War led to greater attention to PTSD and veteran mental health care.
